fields.summary: Add more detailed filter options to see changes to teams and "my changes" in commit dialog.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, there is no easy way of creating an Epic from inside an Initiative.
You have to create the Epic through the Create button and select the Initiative in the Parent link field.

h3. Suggested Solutions
Add a new section to the Initiative so the user can easily create Epics.

Just like we can create Stories when we are inside an Epic.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to easily create Epics from inside an Initiative
Add releases to gantt
Members & Teams

fields.description: As a Portfolio for Jira cloud user, I want to emphasize the manual target start and target due date plan and show the scheduled start/end dates secondarily or optionally.
fields.summary: As a Portfolio for Jira cloud user, I want to emphasize the manual target start and target due date plan

fields.description:
h2. Summary

Currently in Portfolio, if the *Issue assignee import* is enabled and Jira Issue *Assignee* is present on the Scope of the Plan, the scheduling is based on the availability on the *Assignee* of the Issue and not the Team.

To avoid this, the Issue will have to be assigned to an empty Team however with this method, you cannot see who the Issue *Assignee* is from Jira side.

h2. Proposed solution

Add an additional "Assignee level" and "Team level" to the *Scheduling* settings for better control over the scheduling.
fields.summary: Provide an option to configure team or assignee level scheduling
Scheduling errors/warnings should be shown on the parents as well

fields.description:
As a user, I'd like to have the ability to display scheduled end dates for all the sprint at the Schedule timeline panel.
Currently, we can see the dates by hovering the mouse over the timeline but there is no option to toggle it on.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to have the ability to display scheduled end dates for all the sprint at the Schedule timeline panel

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Advanced roadmaps doesn't display estimations and progress when the scope is grouped by components, releases...
 !Screen Shot 2020-05-28 at 14.50.28.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Sum the estimates and progress on the level selected for grouping

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Sum the estimates and progress on the level selected for grouping

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, newly created issues in Jira, having version and sprint set, are displayed in Portfolio without the values of the sprints and versions (releases) 

h3. Suggested Solution

Newly created issues should display their version and sprint values right after reloading the Portfolio page
 
h3. Workaround 

Click the "Calculate" button in Portfolio, it will make the values visible.
fields.summary: As a Portfolio user, I want sprints and versions of newly created issues visible right after the page reload
Option to remove the restriction of needing an estimate before inheriting the assignee from the issue
Add ability to report on hours logged on all child issues of an initiative outside of Portfolio itself
Add export support to the Portfolio Gantt chart
Offer option to honor "assignee" on stories on schedule view

fields.description:
When the new Reactified version of Portfolio arrived, the set targets feature is no longer available.

Please, re-built the functionality to have it available in Portfolio for Jira Cloud again.
fields.summary: With the new Portfolio UI, the set targets functionality is no longer available
Export plan as PDF

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1128].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The release concept is more applicable to development team but less applicable when it comes to professional services team and during customer project implementations.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if if users are able to choose to work with releases or not - and than define end date on specific stories that will basically will be the milestones.
fields.summary: Ability to define start and end date on an issue with out relate it to a release

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1534].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

Portfolio doesn't currently have a feature to sort the projects in Live Plan (Scope view).
- !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Resolution

It would be great if there is a feature to sort the order of the projects.
fields.summary: A feature to sort projects in Live plan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-520].
  {panel}

User would love the ability to save her executives the headache of remembering how to configure that cool view of the Portfolio tool that told them just what they needed to know last week. 

* Add the ability to Save and Name/Rename Report Views as configured (like we can with filters).
* Add the ability to call/display Portfolio Report Views in a JIRA Dashboard or from Confluence.
* Allow the Views to be "live" enough that clicking on a progress bar will pop up details and show dates on the timeline.
fields.summary: Save Portfolio Report Views to Add to JIRA Dashboard
Make "Team" support "is EMPTY" in JQL
Force new tickets for specified Issue Sources to go automatically into the Later release

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1831].
  {panel}

JIRA Software provides the ability to have more than one in-progress sprint on a board.

Portfolio for JIRA cannot cope with this at the moment (see [https://www.google.co.uk/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=1&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwj-5vzu95HSAhWbOsAKHXjkAt0QFggcMAA&url=https%3A%2F%2Fanswers.atlassian.com%2Fquestions%2F39244236%2Fportfolio-handling-of-concurrent-ongoing-sprints&usg=AFQjCNFTncR-C44Oj_iI50pZ5yrMZqnXxg&sig2=_8ka0auE8-9RZUarWSr3Yg)]

 

If a Portfolio for JIRA plan links to a board with more than one in-progress sprint, it will select the first one and the issues in it, and completely ignore the other/s.

This is particularly a problem for dependencies and dependency scheduling, because if an issue further down the backlog _depends_ on an issue in that second in-progress sprint, it will also be 'ignored' and not scheduled because the thing it depends on is not being scheduled.
fields.summary: Support for concurrent sprints

fields.description:
Internally, our software team plans work using issues and epics to organize our work. However, external customers in our organization often need to refer more to our release plan in order to understand when they can expect software to be available.

Portfolio is excellent at communicating the roadmap and the work items involved to us software engineers within the software organization, but it's difficult for our managers to understand when a particular release will arrive by. Releases are how they make their planning decisions. Portfolio could be greatly improved if date information were presented visually as a linear calendar with the release milestones embedded in the calendar cells, rather than as a literal line. While this is a more traditional visual paradigm, it communicates a lot of information that is left out of the simplistic line that is used in Portfolio today.
fields.summary: Make Version Stream and Version Roadmap More Prominent
Add "empty" to filter selections
Ability to specify which stages/skills apply to which project or even issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1738].
  {panel}

As per all of the comments here: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/39986944/answers/40347822/comments/43110013

The key concerns for us with the current implementation are:
* It's not possible to use ScriptRunner's JQL functions (or indeed functions from a variety of add ons) to find children of initiatives that meet certain criteria. With a normal link, or even epic link, it is possible to run JQL to find all linked issues where the parent issue meets certain criteria - for enterprise this is absolutely critical. 
* It's not possible to update the field via scripts, it's possible to do this for epic links
* It's not possible to use add ons like Structure to build hierarchies as this isn't a real link type
* It's not possible to use *basic search* for Parent Link field

This basically means the current implementation of the field/JQL is only useful if you want to find the epics linked to known parent initiatives, which only works if you have a small set of initiatives to work with - we have thousands, and cannot currently create a background link to use for searching when a "parent link" is created because we can't access the field value via scripts. 

Please feel free to contact me if you would like more information about our use cases.
fields.summary: Parent link should behave in the same way as epic link (i.e. forming a link in the background)
Make "Parent Link" support "is EMPTY" in JQL

fields.description:
h3. Problem 

As I user, I want Portfolio to allow me to import the assignee of all issues in my sources instead of only for the hierarchy level set in the *Issue Assignee Import Level* parameter.

h3. Actual Results

Right now, Portfolio will only allow assignee import for those issues in the hierarchy set in the Issue Assignee Import Level.

h3. Suggestion

Allow an option to import all the assignees.
fields.summary: Allow Portfolio to import the assignee of all hierarchy levels simultaneously
Allow for time blocks where no team is assigned but work can't be done
Ability to turn off sorting by columns and revert to rank
Allow setting estimates on structured epics and initiatives

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the columns in the Scope View in the portfolio plan are saved based on the user's choice

h3. Suggested Solution
The customer would want to have the same view for all the users once columns are chosen, similar as in boards.
fields.summary: Save the columns in the columns view as default for all users once configured by administrator

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Portfolio for Jira allows you to plan sprints by adding and scheduling existing issues in the plan to sprints visible, allowing users to commit changes back to Jira, but Portfolio doesn't include an option to start and complete sprints in its view.

h3. Suggested Solution

Add a feature which allows Jira sprints to be started from the Portfolio plan's view
 
h3. Workaround 

Start and complete sprints using Jira boards.
fields.summary: As a Portfolio user, I want to be able to start and complete sprints from the Portfolio view

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-487].
  {panel}

We have a situation where the same team is split between multiple projects. Right now the only ways to represent the team in JPO are either splitting the team manually (which interferes with automatic scheduling) or creating a kitchen sink plan (which is a problem because of JPO-159 and is an antipattern in itself, since it becomes unwieldy).

It would be great if teams were a cross-plan entity and planning was a cross-plan activity, supporting use cases like this (when I say project I mean a waterfall-style activity):

# If project X is the highest priority and project Y is the second-highest, can we go live with any other projects at the next release date? Schedule them and fill up the rest of the capacity with longer projects and our ongoing enhancements Scrum. JPO plans that the first architect will work on project X, then will move to project Z. The other architect will work on project X as well, then a few epics, then project Y, then more epics.
# Oh no, project X task X.1.2 has slipped by two weeks! Reschedule everything, taking into account that task Y.2.4 cannot be shifted, since it is done by an external vendor. Now the architects don't have time to work on project Z, it slips into the next release, and architect 1 is scheduled to work on epics, while architect 2 moves to Y straight from X.
fields.summary: Cross-plan teams and scheduling.
Change Non-Working days per individual/Team
support recurring tasks

fields.description:
In Portfolio you can not have a story scheduled in the same sprint with still respecting the dependency. It is possible to turn of the consideration of dependency completely and there is also a setting for a in-between solution but this is not working how we need it.

we many times have multiple low effort stories which all depend on each other in sequence. Portfolio will push each of those stories in a next sprint even if the captaincy would allow to execute on all dependent stories in the same sprint.

We would like a preference setting to allow a dependent story to get scheduled by portfolio in the same sprint but rank the dependent story under the blocking story.
fields.summary: Allow a dependent story to get scheduled in the same sprint while still respecting the dependency

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1616].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

When user has a lot of exceptions, Portfolio would take up to 5 minutes to open the users page.

 !Screen Shot 2016-09-16 at 1.59.05 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Option to delete all exceptions at once, as Portfolio gets degraded.
fields.summary: Option to bulk delete user exceptions on availability
Add Team Field for Emails

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1482].
  {panel}

*Problem:*
The epic issue type is hard-wired to the 2nd hierarchy level in Portfolio (one above the lowest standard issue types level and two above the sub-tasks level). This can be limiting in case more hierarchy levels are required under the epic issue type.

*Workaround:*
For the time being, another issue type needs to be used to fulfil the purpose of the epic issue type. This type can then be mapped to any hierarchy level and thus will allow for more hierarchy levels below.

*Solution:*
Allow mapping the epic issue type to other hierarchy levels.
fields.summary: Make mapping of Epic issue type configurable in Live Plans hierarchy configuration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1816].
  {panel}

h5. Problem Definition
At the moment, Portfolio's live plan will show active sprint from the board that is listed as issue sources. Even if the issues associated to this active sprint are not being filtered in the plan (under scope).

h5. Suggested Solution
It would be great to have the option to exclude the active sprint in the board whose issues are not in portfolio live plan.
fields.summary: Having the option to exclude active sprint whose issues are not listed under scope

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1766].
  {panel}

One of the most useful reports in Portfolio is the capacity report.  This is shareable via a link, but none of the raw data, booked, unbooked, utilisation and constraints etc that is available in the clickable popup  for each bar is visible.  

I would really like this information, in order to produce a capacity planning report for the Executive Board.  Please make this information available in a csv/excel export like the scope report.

One other suggestions that I think have already been raised. filter and group by stage so I can see how much capacity is available in test VS development stages.  

 

Expose portfolio data via the API's  so we can extract this data
fields.summary: CSV export for Capacity Report
Set Skills on Issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1843].
  {panel}

The documentation [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/configuring-teams-members-availability-814212629.html] outlines functionality that we do not see present in our JIRA Portfolio 2.2 for server instance. Specifically:
 # There is no way to access member scheduling from the "Teams" panel - it must be done by going to Portfolio\Manage Shared Teams.
 # There is no way to set per-team availability in either the "Teams" panel or the "Manage Shared Teams" screen
 # There is no way to set "exceptions", only "absences" (the difference appears to be that an exception allows for partial impacts).

I have checked JAC to confirm that there isn't a filed bug for these features, and I have checked our Portfolio permissions to make sure I have 'shared team management' access.
fields.summary: Fix "Configuring teams members' availability" Documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1217].

As a user I want to apply changes to multiple backlog items. For instance:
# release
# sprint
# team
# initiative
# epic
# version
fields.summary: Bulk changes
Mapping of Portfolio teams into Jira

Users might have external dependencies not displayed on plan. On this situation the users manually enter the start date however that is overridden by the auto-schedule.

h3. Suggested Solution

fields.description:
h3. The feature
Currently, is not possible for Jira Administrators to use Fields from Portfolio, such as "Release Dates" as custom fields in Jira Cloud, apart from "Parent Link".

h3. The suggestion
Provide more options of fields so administrators may be able to have a more granular report on Plans and Boards.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to use Portfolio fields as Custom Fields in Jira
Start date on team level should be configurable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1617].
  {panel}

h2. Problem

Currently there is no daily scheduling within Scrum sprints or hourly schedule within Kanban projects.

Portfolio tries to solve a scheduling problem involving humans in a domain where stories are known to be difficult to estimate.
 When the story estimates are precise and stories are dependent on the results of previous stories in a sequential manner, Portfolio is not able to schedule accurately.

If on a Kanban project, short dependent stories that are meant to be sequential, they can be either scheduled concurrently (if resources are available) or on different days.
 In Scrum projects, dependent stories will either be scheduled concurrently (if resources are available) or on different sprints. There is no sub-sprint granularity.

As an scheduler, I'd like stories with dependencies to be scheduled after the completion of the blocking story but in the same sprint or day if resources permit.
h2. Configuration Examples:

When using Portfolio in Scrum mode:
 * With Dependent Story Constraint switched on, dependant stories can't be in the same sprint, even if they have a short duration.
 * With Dependant Story Constraint switched off, the blocked story won't start before the dependant story but stories may be scheduled concurrently, so the dependant stories may be scheduled by Portfolio before the dependant story is complete and can actually be worked on.

When using Portfolio in Kanban mode:
 * With Dependent Story Constraint switched on, dependant stories are scheduled the next day, disregarding the estimates. 3 dependent stories of 1h are scheduled in 3 different days.
 * With Dependant Story Constraint switched off, dependent stories may be scheduled concurrently and 3 dependent stories of 6h scheduled in the same 8h day if resources allow.

The ON option doesn't allow for stories to be scheduled in a sequential manner with a granularity of hours.
 The OFF option is expected to ignore story completion dependency.
h2. Suggestion:

I'd like an option to enforce more granularity, so the schedule is done on an hourly basis for Kanban and daily basis for Scrum.
 Alternatively: a configurable timespan (week or sprint) to calculate at a higher granularity.
h2. Notes:

The time granularity is a linear factor in the complexity of the scheduling algorithm and increases will cause slowness when calculating the schedule.
h2. Use cases:
 * Sequential stories for operational Kanban teams. Some stories are done manually and others automated and normally short (1h). Estimates are precise.
 * Scrum teams that have well planned dependencies that form a chain of concurrent stories that may or may not fit the sprint.
fields.summary: Improve scheduling granularity

fields.description:
Hello,

Currently I have a lot of tickets on my backlog which are dependant on other tickets being solved first. We create in those tickets the relation 'ticket X requires ticket Y'.

But I have not found a mechanism in which I can see on the backlog that ticket X can be picked up because ticket Y has been solved already. So is there a way in which I can see on the backlog that the required ticket has been solved? For example by automatically change the apperance of the ticket visually similar to adding a flag.

E-mail notifications are not a solution for me in this case since my mailbox is already overflooding and then I would still need to change something in the ticket in Jira myself (or drag it up) to make it clear it can be picked up in one of the upcoming sprint plannings.

I haven't found a ticket about this and would like to know if there is already a solution for tracking this situation. Otherwise I would like to know the opinions about how other product owners manage this relation.
fields.summary: Visual change of ticket on backlog when required ticket is closed
Calculate actual values in reports page based on progress for plans in story points
Alphabetize the list of projects in the inline creation dropdown
Show icons in the backlog view
Make Portfolio Live Plans issue hierarchy information visible in JIRA

fields.description:
h4. Actual behavior

The _Estimates_ column in Portfolio reflects the _Remaining_ time from your issue in Jira.

When you use story points as estimation in Jira issues, if you log work on an issue, the _Remaining_ becomes zero. 

If you configure the plan to convert estimation from story points to hours and log work on in an issue, the Portfolio plan shows the issue estimation as "0" (zero)


h4. Expected behavior

As a Portfolio user, I want to keep seeing the ticket's story points converted value estimation after logging work into it.
fields.summary: As a Portfolio user, I want to keep seeing the converted estimation after logging hours
Make plan name mandatory in create plan wizard
Cannot get to add-ons for Project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1514].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
All our Product Owners want to be able to plan Stories into releases/Fixed Version/s using the Back on the Agile board and then see a timeline view of this in a Portfolio Plan.
However, when the Portfolio plan/timeline is generated, Stories that haven't had a release/Fixed Version/s assigned to them often end up being automatically scheduled into Releases (and have a blue Release assignment in the Scope section of the Portfolio Plan). This behaviour is never desired in the way our Product Owners want to use Portfolio and always results in a lot of confusion and questions as unexpected Stories end up being included in releases

h3. Suggested Solution
To implement more flexibility in the scheduling configuration
fields.summary: option to stop the scheduling algorithm

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The Cloud and server Documents for configuring team member avaliability both focus on different sections and are missing the alternate portion

The Server Doc:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/configuring-the-availability-of-team-members-814212629.html
** Contains Details of the settings under the Teams tab only

The Cloud Doc:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfoliocloud/configuring-team-members-availability-828785286.html
** Contains details on the settings under the People Tab Only


h3. Suggested Solution
Both Sections are available on each platform and the configuration settings need to be present on both platforms
 
h3. Workaround
The Information for configuration is the same for each platform with the exception of visual differences in the screenshots, but navigation options and settings line up and can be used on either platform until the data is added to each location
fields.summary: Missing details on portfolio Docs Cloud & Server
(Portfolio Scope Tab) Filter Dropdowns would get "Not Set" option

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1414].
  {panel}

*Problem*
When team members were manually assigned to an issue and another team is selected, the member assignments are dropped. As a consequence, any members that were assigned to the issue by the algorithm will show up in the members column, even if they don't match the assigned team. You basically have an outdated calculation result now and need to recalculate the plan to get matching member assignments.

You can, however, of course already select members of the team set that will be taken into account by the algorithm when recalculating the plan.

*Suggested solution*
Showing the outdated members has proven to be confusing for customers and we could not show calculated members unless they match the assigned team.
fields.summary: Live Plans - Do not show calculated team members in case they no longer match the selected team
Drag and drop Epics / Stories over teams in the backlog graph
Add Epic Report in Jira Portfolio
Use parent link between Story and Task
As a project manager I should be able to see shift from my baseline plan in the gantt view

h3. Workaround

fields.summary: Allow user to sort the plan scope using a custom field

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1759].

h3. Problem Description

# Have some releases which has different start and end dates.
# Have some issues and teams in it.
# Select a team (from the filter) who work on issues from the middle period of the timeline until the end.
# Portfolio will show the timeline with the same period and highlighting/showing only those issues while leaving the past data to be empty.

fields.summary: Provide a feature to narrow down the timeline if the past data is empty
Ability to sort on the warning column
Adding an Issue to a Sprint that's in progress should warn the Portfolio user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1528].
  {panel}

Hi!

Our company considers JP as a tool to manage and track our business activities at portfolio / department level.

The problem is our 10000+ license JIRA is used both by IT teams and corporate divisons. It means that Hierarchy levels configured (theirs actual names) may pertain to one Line of business and mismatch another another one..

If there was a possibility somehow to define hierarchy levels per plan (or even though per plan's category/template), that would make it much easier.
fields.summary: Make hierarchy levels configurable per plan

fields.description:
Currently, there is no way to filter information in the Dependency report, neither filters os using saved views. A plan with too many dependencies would be hard to use.

As a Portfolio administrator, I want to see be able to filter information in Dependency report by dependency type, once it is possible to create different types of dependencies
fields.summary: As a Portfolio administrator, I want to see be able to filter information in Dependency report based on filters and saved views

fields.description:
Currently Portfolio schedules as much as possible for a team member without trying to spread the work which could result in some people being at full capacity and some no work at all.

To preserve both behavior it would be nice to have a scheduling option to allow spreading the work evenly across team members.
fields.summary: Add a calculation setting to spread capacity evenly

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-537].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Customer is utilizing Manual Recalculation for JIRA Portfolio however the Recalculate button can be clicked unintentionally causing a recalculation before all changes have been made

h3. Suggested Solution
When in Manual Recalculation mode, generate a Confirmation Popup Message when the Recalculate button is clicked
 
h3. Workaround 
None, avoid the Recalculate Button until all changes have been made.
fields.summary: Confirmation Popup for Manual Recalculation in Portfolio

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1506].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Description

Portfolio doesn't currently have a report to display the total number of free capacity for each version.

h3. Suggested Resolution

It would be great to have a report that could display it.
fields.summary: Provide a report to display free capacity per version

fields.description:
Portfolio tries scheduling the ranked higher issues to the release with the closest start date. If the later release starts before this release, issues on later release will start before the ranked higher ones.

I'd like that portfolio schedule the issues to the closest start date available and not the closest release available.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like that Portfolio schedule my issues to the closest start date available and not the closest release available.
Create issue links to reflect the hierarchy in Portoflio Live plans on JIRA issues
Wrong Sorting Tasks on timeline according priority
Modify behavior when clicking a schedule bar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-495].
  {panel}

Currently, I can freeze the Original Estimate on a per item basis.
As my backlog has a large number of items (i.e. Epics), I would like to be able freeze the Original Estimate of all (or a set?) of them in just one click.
This should of course come on top of the existing mechanism "per item".

This sort of baseline would later help me compare a snapshot taken at a given time with the current situation
fields.summary: Automate the "keep estimates as reference"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOSERVER-1490].
  {panel}

*Problem Definition*

In Portfolio's live plans, it looks like when viewing the 'epic' hierarchy level, the timeline will show the overall duration of the epic including its children. When viewing the 'story' hierarchy level, epics normally don't show up at all unless there is an estimate set on the epic. This 'unstructured' part of the epic that is not represented by any of its stories will be visible in the timeline even when viewing the 'story' level.

*Suggested Solution*

Raise a documentation for Portfolio to explain the behaviour so user can understand it.

*Workaround*

None.
fields.summary: Portfolio Epic in Live Plans
